question: What is the source of coronavirus in humans?
answer: Animals, probably bats

question: How many pandemics were there in the 20th century?
answer: Three

question: When was the molecular structure of the coronovirus identfied?
answer: Fuburary 1st, 2020

question: Why is the new coronavirus called "COVID-19"?
answer: It stands for "COronaVIrus Disease 2019"

question: Which was the first US University to cancel classes becuase of the new coronavirus?
answer: University of Washington
comments: DS: This information can be useful or not depending on where a person lives

question: Which celebrity said about the new coronavirus "I've already been in this movie"?
answer: Gwyneth Paltrow

question: What color latex gloves did Naomi Campbell wear to protect herself from coronavirus?
answer: Pink

question: What is the name of the county in Italy that had the first coronavirus outbreak?
answer: Lombardy

question: What is the name of the province in China in which this new coronavirus was first discovered?
answer: Hubei

question: What is the population of Wuhan, the city in which coronavirus was first identified?
answer: 11 million people

question: Wuhan, China, the city in which the coronavirus was first identified, is commonly referred to as the chinese version of what American city?
answer: The Chicago of China

question: What was the name of the British cruise ship that was quarantined in Japanese waters?
answer: Diamond Princess

question: Why is the virus believed to have zoonotic origin, i.e., to have potentially come from animals?
answer: The initial cases of the disease are thought to have been among people with a connection to a seafood wholesale market, which also sold live animals

question: On what date did the World Health Organization declare the new coronavirus outbreak to be a Public Health Emergency of International Concern?
answer: January 30, 2020

question: In the early stages of the new coronavirus, the number of new cases doubled approximately every how many days?
answer: 7.5 days
comments: RH: info maybe? if you want to evaluate risk?

question: What other animals have been found to have viruses with highly similar genome sequences as the current coronavirus?
answer: Bats and pangolins

question: The name for the new disease COVID-19 adheres to WHO best practices in disease naming, which include guidelines to not name disease after what?
answer: Locations, people, or animals

question: Why are N95 respirator face masks so named?
answer: They are able to filter out at least 95% of airborne particles

question: What is the name of the repository of drugs and supplies the U.S. government is supposed to maintain in case of a public health emergency?
answer: Strategic National Stockpile

question: In May 2018, Rear Admiral Timothy Ziemer left the White House staff and was not replaced. What was Rear Adm. Ziemer's responsibility in the White House?
answer: Rear Adm. Ziemer led the global health security team, responsible for leading the US response to pandemics.

question: An epidemic is the outbreak of a disease that affects many people at the same time. What does pandemic mean?
answer: An epidemic that has spread around the world

question: What is the name of the process health authorities use to understand the sources of infection and to prevent further transmission?
answer: Contact tracing

question: At the end of February, Amazon banned over a million products because of what?
answer: They falsely claimed to cure or prevent coronavirus

question: According to media reports, which 2011 movie has seen a large increase in popularity in the wake of the new coronavirus?
answer: Contagion

question: What is the supposed origin of the name coronavirus?
answer: The viruses have spikes on their outer surface that look like a crown (or corona in Latin)

question: The official name of the new coronavirus is SARS-CoV-2. What does SARS stand for?
answer: Severe acute respiratory syndrome

question: What is the most effective measure to prevent infection with the coronavirus?
answer: Washing your hands frequently

question: Does sleep make you more resistant to coronavirus infections?
answer: Yes, by boosting the immune system

question: How soon is a vaccine for the new coronavirus likely to be available?
answer: Not for at least several months from now

question: Are the new coronavirus symptoms more similar to the symptoms of flu, or of seasonal allergies?
answer: More similar to the symptoms of the ful

question: Can the coronavirus be transmitted through sexual intercourse?
answer: The virus is probably not sexually tansmissible, but infection does occurs when kissing.

question: The CDC recommend people wear cloth masks when they do what?
answer: In public settings where other social distancing measures are difficult to maintain (e.g., grocery stores and pharmacies).

question: Can the new coronavirus be transmitted by touching a soft surface like carpets or fabric?
answer: Soft surfaces are less likely to transmit the virus than hard surfaces.

question: Can the new coronavirus be transmitted on a package from an infected country?
answer: The virus lives for up to a few days on surfaces, and so packages cannot transmit the virus.

question: Can the new coronavirus be transmitted through mosquito bites?
answer: The virus spreads through coughs and sneezes, there are no reports of transmission through mosquito bites.

question: Can regularly rinsing your nose with saline help prevent infection with the new coronavirus?
answer: No. There is no evidence that regularly rinsing the nose with saline has protected people from infection with the new coronavirus.

question: Can eating garlic help prevent infection with the new coronavirus?
answer: There is no evidence from the current outbreak that eating garlic has protected people from the new coronavirus.

question: Does the new coronavirus affect older people, or are younger people also susceptible?
answer: People of all ages can be infected by the new coronavirus. Older people appear to be more vulnerable to becoming severely ill with the virus.

question: Are antibiotics effective in preventing and treating the new coronavirus?
answer: No, antibiotics do not work against viruses, only bacteria.

question: How long is the incubation period for the new coronavirus?
answer: The incubation period - the time between catching the virus and beginning to have symptoms of the disease - is estimated to range from 1-14 days, most commonly around five days.

question: How long does the new coronavirus survive on surfaces?
answer: Studies suggest that coronaviruses (including preliminary information on the new virus) may persist on surfaces for a few hours or up to several days.

question: What are the most common symptoms of the new coronavirus?
answer: Fever, cough, shortness of breath.

question: Currently, people who  may have been in contact with someone with the new coronavirus are recommended to do what?
answer: Quarantine themselves for 14 days to make sure they are not infected.

question: Approximately 80% of deaths attributed to the new coronavirus were among people of what age?
answer: People over age 60

question: What did 75% of the people who have died from the new coronavirus have?
answer: Pre-existing health conditions, including cardiovascular diseases and diabetes.

question: Which drug, which has been used as a treatment for the Ebola and Marburg viruses, might be promising as a treatment for this new coronavirus?
answer: Remdesivir

question: What are current Centers for Disease Control (CDC) guidelines for releasing someone from isolation?
answer: Free of fever; no other symptoms, including cough; negative tests on at least two consecutive respiratory specimens at least 24 hours apart.

question: Why does the CDC currently recommend that healthy people do not wear N95 face masks?
answer: Reserves need to be saved for people who are infected and for healthcare professionals.

question: It is recommended that healthcare professionals who may be working in contact with people with the virus wear what, in addition to personal protective equipment on their hands and bodies?
answer: Approved filtering facemask respirators, such as the N95 respirator.

question: The first US death from the new coronavirus occurred in which state?
answer: Washington

question: What sort of specimen is needed to test for the new coronavirus?
answer: Nasal or orab swab or a sample of sputum
